intro: Mikania nigropunctulata var. denticulifolia, commonly known as the denticulate morning glory, is a climbing vine native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its rapid growth, it can become invasive in certain areas.
